resources.string: Play to get involved into the beauties of Greece and help to minimize the environmental impact of tourism industry
What you can do in Acropolis?

Parthenon is located in Acropolis, the heart of Athens.\nAthens is the capital of Greece.\nParthenon was built in 438BCE and it is one of the greatests archaeological monuments in the world, symbolizing the birth of Democracy.

Sightseeing:

->Visit the Acropolis to see the monuments.
->Visit the museum of Acropolis.
->Visit the centre of Athens(Monastirakion Square, Plaka, Thiseion) and many more.

Cuisine: 

What it is better than souvlaki and backlava?
In the centre of Athens you could taste the most greek foods that you could find.

Transportation: 

You could use the metro, suburban railways and do walking and cycling to navigate through Athens to minimize the production of CO2.
The Navagio/Shipwreck Beach is a very famous beach in the Ionian Sea.\nLocated in the Zakenthos Island.

The Shipwreck Beach is the most fascinating beach you could visit.

To Do List:

->Enjoy the refreshing deep blue waters, with the shipwreck on sight!
->Get your perfect tan from the hot sun, but always use sunscreen.
->Visit all the amazing places Zakenthos has!

Cuisine:

Enjoy the local food of Zakenthos, like fresh fish and seafood, souvlaki, loukoumia and more.
What you can do in Shipwreck Beach?
What can you do in Thessaloniki?
Level %d\nWhere is the White Tower located?
Thessaloniki is the second largest town of Greece\n

Sightseeing:

->Visit the White Tower.
->Visit Aristotelous Square
->Visit Great Alexanders Statue and more

Cuisine:

Come to thessaloniki to try the delicious bougatsa. Also you could try koulouri, trigona/triangle of perama and more!

Transportation:

You could do cycling, walking and use urban buses to minimize CO2 production.
